description: The Ann & Sandy Cross Conservation Area (ASCCA) is a 4,800 acre day use natural area.  It is located just south west of the city of Calgary containing trails in rolling foothills land.A natural area that can be good for shoulder seasons hikes to stretch out the legs before the snow melts in the mountains.The website for this area can be found at http://www.crossconservation.org
directions: Head west on highway 22x from Calgary, turn south on 160 st SW, the road to the parking lot is located at the end of 160 st (approximately 3.2 kilometers south of 22x)
title: Ann & Sandy Cross Conservation Area
